pgBasicChannelTable.name: pgBasicChannelTable
pgBasicChannelTable.description: Status and configuration information for a collection of channels in the Paragon system concentrator.

pgBasicChannelEntry.name: pgBasicChannelEntry
pgBasicChannelEntry.description: Status and configuration information for a particular channel in the Paragon system concentrator.

pgChannelID.name: pgChannelID
pgChannelID.description: The value of the Paragon Channel ID is assigned so as to uniquely identify a channel in the Paragon system where a single agent manages multiple channels.

pgChannelIPGCount.name: pgChannelIPGCount
pgChannelIPGCount.description: pgChannelIPGCount object counts the number of IPGs below the object pgMonRptrIPGThreshold, since agent reset.

pgChannelIPGThreshold.name: pgChannelIPGThreshold
pgChannelIPGThreshold.description: This object can be set to trigger a proprietary Threshold Crossed Trap. The IPG Threshold is measured in bit times. (e.g. If the inter-packet gap is 9.6 us, this is equivalent to 96 bit times).

pgChannelMinimumIPG.name: pgChannelMinimumIPG
pgChannelMinimumIPG.description: pgChannelMinimumIPG object identifies the lowest inter-packet gap value in bit times obtained for this repeater since the last agent reset.

pgChannelStatus.name: pgChannelStatus
pgChannelStatus.description: The pgChannelStatus indicates whether the Paragon system agent can control/monitor the channel effectively.

pgChannelNumOfCards.name: pgChannelNumOfCards
pgChannelNumOfCards.description: The pgChannelNumOfCards object identifies the number of groups currently in the Paragon system concentrator which can potentially connect to this channel. Note: A group is connected to a channel when at least one of its ports is connected to the channel.

pgBasicCardTable.name: pgBasicCardTable
pgBasicCardTable.description: Table of descriptive information about the groups of ports. This table will return the same information regardles of the pgCardChannelBasicID

pgBasicCardEntry.name: pgBasicCardEntry
pgBasicCardEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a single group of ports.

pgCardChannelBasicID.name: pgCardChannelBasicID
pgCardChannelBasicID.description: Channel ID for identifying the card.

pgCardBasicID.name: pgCardBasicID
pgCardBasicID.description: A value unique within the Paragon system concentrator, where the slots are numbered from left to right.

pgCardType.name: pgCardType
pgCardType.description: The pgCardType object is a text string that contains the product code for order entry purposes (e.g. EOM-0601).

pgCardSize.name: pgCardSize
pgCardSize.description: The pgCardSize object indicates the number of slots the card occupies in the Paragon system concentrator.

pgCardSerialID.name: pgCardSerialID
pgCardSerialID.description: The pgCardSerialID object contains a unique serial code.

pgBasicPortTable.name: pgBasicPortTable
pgBasicPortTable.description: Table of descriptive information about the ports.

pgBasicPortEntry.name: pgBasicPortEntry
pgBasicPortEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a single port.

pgPortChannelBasicID.name: pgPortChannelBasicID
pgPortChannelBasicID.description: Channel ID for identifying the port.

pgPortCardBasicID.name: pgPortCardBasicID
pgPortCardBasicID.description: Card ID for identifying the port.

pgPortBasicID.name: pgPortBasicID
pgPortBasicID.description: A value unique on the card indicating the port ID.

pgPortMediaType.name: pgPortMediaType
pgPortMediaType.description: The pgPortMediaType object describes the port's media type. The ETM-1201-50 card will support either Shielded or Unshielded Twisted Pair through jumper selection. The pgPortMediaType will always return Twisted Pair since this selection is not manageable.

pgAgentSerialNum.name: pgAgentSerialNum
pgAgentSerialNum.description: The pgAgentSerialNum object contains a unique serial code for the agent module hardware.

pgAgentSoftware.name: pgAgentSoftware
pgAgentSoftware.description: The pgAgentSoftware object contains the agent module's software revision level.

pgAgentROM.name: pgAgentROM
pgAgentROM.description: The pgAgentROM object contains the agent module's ROM revision level.

pgAgentFlowControl.name: pgAgentFlowControl
pgAgentFlowControl.description: The pgAgentFlowControl indicates whether the flow control for the serial port is enabled.

pgAgentBaud.name: pgAgentBaud
pgAgentBaud.description: The pgAgentBaud indicates the baud rate for the agent module's serial port.

pgAgentStopBits.name: pgAgentStopBits
pgAgentStopBits.description: The pgAgentStopBits object indicates the number of stop bits in use for the agent`s serial port.

pgAgentParity.name: pgAgentParity
pgAgentParity.description: The pgAgentParity indicates the parity in use for the agent module's serial port.

pgAgentCommBandType.name: pgAgentCommBandType
pgAgentCommBandType.description: pgAgentCommBandType object indicates whether communication between the agent module and the pgAgentCurrentPrimary network management station is in-band or out-of-band.

pgAgentTimeout.name: pgAgentTimeout
pgAgentTimeout.description: pgAgentTimeout object indicates the amount of time before an agent will search for a new NMS upon receiving no communication from the current NMS. A zero value inhibits the agent from ever searching for a new NMS.

pgAgentDesignatedPrimary.name: pgAgentDesignatedPrimary
pgAgentDesignatedPrimary.description: pgAgentDesignatedPrimary object identifies the network address of the 'Primary' network management station. The 'Primary' NMS is designated by the agent's download server.

pgAgentLastAuthFail.name: pgAgentLastAuthFail
pgAgentLastAuthFail.description: pgAgentLastAuthFail object identifies the last SNMP entity which caused the agent to issue a standard SNMP authentiction trap.

pgAgentLastSecurityFail.name: pgAgentLastSecurityFail
pgAgentLastSecurityFail.description: pgAgentLastSecurityFail object identifies the last SNMP entity which caused the agent to issue a proprietary Security Failure trap.

pgAgentCurrentPrimary.name: pgAgentCurrentPrimary
pgAgentCurrentPrimary.description: pgAgentCurrentPrimary object identifies the current 'Primary' network management station by network address. Note: this variable is only read-write for a SNMP Set-Request delivered from the pgAgentDesignatedPrimary.

pgAgentDownloadServer.name: pgAgentDownloadServer
pgAgentDownloadServer.description: pgAgentDownloadServer object identifies the download server station by network address.

pgAgentLastSetRequest.name: pgAgentLastSetRequest
pgAgentLastSetRequest.description: pgAgentLastSetRequest object identifies the last SNMP entity that sent a SET-REQUEST to the agent.

pgAgentDipSwitches.name: pgAgentDipSwitches
pgAgentDipSwitches.description: This octet string represents the current configuration of the agent's dipswitch settings, encoded as a bit string. Each dipswitch is represented by a single bit. When the value of a bit=1, it indicates that the dipswitch is set to the ON position. The number of octets is 2 to represent the 10 dipswitches. The first octet will encode the configuration of dipswitches 1-8, where 1 represents the Serial Port Access, 2 represents the Timeout Feature, and 3 represents the Security Feature,7 represents agent configuration, and 8 represents talking through a router. The rest of the dipswitches are currently not used.

pgAgentNetPackAddr1.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr1
pgAgentNetPackAddr1.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr1 object contains the network address for the NetPack1.

pgAgentNetPackAddr2.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr2
pgAgentNetPackAddr2.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr2 object contains the network address for the NetPack2.

pgAgentNetPackAddr3.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr3
pgAgentNetPackAddr3.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr3 object contains the network address for the NetPack3.

pgAgentNetPackAddr4.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr4
pgAgentNetPackAddr4.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr4 object contains the network address for the NetPack4.

pgAgentNetPackAddr5.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr5
pgAgentNetPackAddr5.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr5 object contains the network address for the NetPack5.

pgAgentNetPackAddr6.name: pgAgentNetPackAddr6
pgAgentNetPackAddr6.description: pgAgentNetPackAddr6 object contains the network address for the NetPack6.

pgAgentLearnedNMSTable.name: pgAgentLearnedNMSTable
pgAgentLearnedNMSTable.description: Table of information about the network management stations which have communicated with the agent.

pgAgentLearnedNMSEntry.name: pgAgentLearnedNMSEntry
pgAgentLearnedNMSEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a network management station which has communicated with the agent.

pgAgentLearnedNMSAddr.name: pgAgentLearnedNMSAddr
pgAgentLearnedNMSAddr.description: pgAgentLearnedNMSAddr object identifies the address of the NMS which has communicated with this agent.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr1.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr1
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr1.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr1 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack1.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr2.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr2
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr2.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr2 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack2.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr3.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr3
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr3.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr3 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack3.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr4.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr4
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr4.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr4 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack4.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr5.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr5
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr5.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr5 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack5.

pgAgentNetPackMACAddr6.name: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr6
pgAgentNetPackMACAddr6.description: pgAgentNetPackMACAddr6 object contains the MAC address for the NetPack6.

pgAgentNetPackState1.name: pgAgentNetPackState1
pgAgentNetPackState1.description: pgAgentNetPackState1 object identifies the state of the NetPack1.

pgAgentNetPackState2.name: pgAgentNetPackState2
pgAgentNetPackState2.description: pgAgentNetPackState2 object identifies the state of the NetPack2.

pgAgentNetPackState3.name: pgAgentNetPackState3
pgAgentNetPackState3.description: pgAgentNetPackState3 object identifies the state of the NetPack3.

pgAgentNetPackState4.name: pgAgentNetPackState4
pgAgentNetPackState4.description: pgAgentNetPackState4 object identifies the state of the NetPack4.

pgAgentNetPackState5.name: pgAgentNetPackState5
pgAgentNetPackState5.description: pgAgentNetPackState5 object identifies the state of the NetPack5.

pgAgentNetPackState6.name: pgAgentNetPackState6
pgAgentNetPackState6.description: pgAgentNetPackState6 object identifies the state of the NetPack6.

pgAgentConfigChanges.name: pgAgentConfigChanges
pgAgentConfigChanges.description: Denotes whether a configuration change has been noted in the Concentrator after a power-up condition. This object is bound as part of the ColdStart Trap optional variables.

pgAgentDaughterboard.name: pgAgentDaughterboard
pgAgentDaughterboard.description: Status condition for the Agent Module optional Daughterboard.

pgAgentInternalBus.name: pgAgentInternalBus
pgAgentInternalBus.description: Status condition for the Agent Module MCI Bus

pgAgentCorrelator.name: pgAgentCorrelator
pgAgentCorrelator.description: Status condition for the Agent Module Data Acquisition Foreground Process.

pgAgentNetPackStatus1.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus1
pgAgentNetPackStatus1.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus1 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgAgentNetPackStatus2.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus2
pgAgentNetPackStatus2.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus2 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgAgentNetPackStatus3.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus3
pgAgentNetPackStatus3.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus3 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgAgentNetPackStatus4.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus4
pgAgentNetPackStatus4.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus4 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgAgentNetPackStatus5.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus5
pgAgentNetPackStatus5.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus5 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgAgentNetPackStatus6.name: pgAgentNetPackStatus6
pgAgentNetPackStatus6.description: pgAgentNetPackStatus6 object indicates the current operational status of the Agent's NetPack.

pgMonitorRptrTable.name: pgMonitorRptrTable
pgMonitorRptrTable.description: Statistics for the current functioning repeater in the concentrator.

pgMonitorRptrEntry.name: pgMonitorRptrEntry
pgMonitorRptrEntry.description: Entry for the current functioning repeater in the concentrator.

pgMonRptrID.name: pgMonRptrID
pgMonRptrID.description: pgMonRptrID identifies the repeaterfor which this entry contains monitor information.

pgMonRptrTotalFrames.name: pgMonRptrTotalFrames
pgMonRptrTotalFrames.description: pgMonRptrTotalFrames counts the total number of frames that have been received by the repeater, including error prone packets.

pgMonRptrTotalReadFrames.name: pgMonRptrTotalReadFrames
pgMonRptrTotalReadFrames.description: pgMonRptrTotalReadFrames counts the total number of frames that have valid frame length and no FCS Errors.

pgMonRptrTotalFCSErrs.name: pgMonRptrTotalFCSErrs
pgMonRptrTotalFCSErrs.description: pgMonRptrTotalFCSErrs counts the total number of frames that have FCS Errors and no Framing Errors. The frame size must also be greater than or equal to 64 octets and less than or equal to 1518 octets.

pgMonRptrTotalAlignmentErrs.name: pgMonRptrTotalAlignmentErrs
pgMonRptrTotalAlignmentErrs.description: pgMonRptrTotalAlignmentErrs counts the total number of frames that have both FCS Errors and Framing Errors. The frame size must also be greater than or equal to 64 octets and less than or equal to 1518 octets.

pgMonRptrTotalRunts.name: pgMonRptrTotalRunts
pgMonRptrTotalRunts.description: pgMonRptrTotalRunts counts the total number of collision fragments with runt errors (frames longer than 74 bits and less than 512 bits).

pgMonRptrTotalLateColl.name: pgMonRptrTotalLateColl
pgMonRptrTotalLateColl.description: pgMonRptrTotalLateColl counts the total number of collision fragments with size longer than 512 bits.

pgMonRptrTotalShortEvents.name: pgMonRptrTotalShortEvents
pgMonRptrTotalShortEvents.description: pgMonRptrTotalShortEvents of fragments received by the repeater that are less than 74 bits in length.

pgMonRptrMPRStatus.name: pgMonRptrMPRStatus
pgMonRptrMPRStatus.description: pgMonRptrMPRStatus indicates the current status of the MPR. It will display the value of Normal when the MPR is not experiencing one of the error conditions. If more than one of the error conditions is present in close succession, a pgMPRErrors trap will be sent for each of the error conditions noted. pgMonRptrMPRStatus will hold the value of the most recent status.

pgMonRptrMPRMJLPCount.name: pgMonRptrMPRMJLPCount
pgMonRptrMPRMJLPCount.description: pgMonRptrMPRMJLPCount indicates the number of times the MAU Jabber Lockup Protection (MJLP) has been activated. This variable counts how many times the MPR has noted jabbering on a port and has initiated its MJLP feature to control this jabbering. After a port has sent 50 milliseconds of constant data, the MJLP feature will interrupt a port and stop data from being sent on that port for 10 microseconds.

pgMonitorPortTable.name: pgMonitorPortTable
pgMonitorPortTable.description: Table of statistical information about the monitored ports.

pgMonitorPortEntry.name: pgMonitorPortEntry
pgMonitorPortEntry.description: An entry in the pgMonitorPortTable, containing statistical information about a single port.

pgMonPortRptrID.name: pgMonPortRptrID
pgMonPortRptrID.description: Repeater ID for the specified port.

pgMonPortCardID.name: pgMonPortCardID
pgMonPortCardID.description: Card ID for the specified port.

pgMonPortID.name: pgMonPortID
pgMonPortID.description: A value unique to the card indicating the port ID.

pgMonPortTotalFrames.name: pgMonPortTotalFrames
pgMonPortTotalFrames.description: pgMonPortTotalFrames is a count of the number of frames that have been received by the port, including error prone packets.

pgMonPortTotalCollisions.name: pgMonPortTotalCollisions
pgMonPortTotalCollisions.description: pgMonPortTotalCollisions is a count of the number of fragments that have size less than 512 bits.

pgMonPortCollRate.name: pgMonPortCollRate
pgMonPortCollRate.description: pgMonPortCollRate is a calculation of the total number of collisions for the last second divided by the frames received (pgMonPortTotalFrames) for the last second. This value is expressed in tenths of a percent.

pgMonPortCollThreshold.name: pgMonPortCollThreshold
pgMonPortCollThreshold.description: pgMonPortCollThreshold is the threshold value for collision rate in percent which, if reached, causes a proprietary trap notification to be sent to the NMS.

pgMonPortLateCollisions.name: pgMonPortLateCollisions
pgMonPortLateCollisions.description: pgMonPortLateCollisions is the count of collisions which occured after 512 bit times.

pgMonPortErrorRate.name: pgMonPortErrorRate
pgMonPortErrorRate.description: pgMonPortErrorRate is a calculation of the total number of errors (FCS, Alignment, Short Events, Frames Too Long) for the last second divided by the frames received (pgMonPortTotalFrames) for the last second. This value is expressed in tenths of a percent.

pgMonPortErrorThreshold.name: pgMonPortErrorThreshold
pgMonPortErrorThreshold.description: pgMonPortErrorThreshold is the threshold value for error rate in percent which, if reached, causes a proprietary trap notification to be sent to the NMS.

pgMonPortOutOfRange.name: pgMonPortOutOfRange
pgMonPortOutOfRange.description: pgMonPortOutOfRange is count of frames which are noted as having their size out of the range for good frames. That is either greater than 1518 octets or less than 64 octets.

pgMonPortCollHysteresis.name: pgMonPortCollHysteresis
pgMonPortCollHysteresis.description: pgMonPortCollHysteresis is the hysteresis value for the collision rate in percent which if crossed (after a Threshold cross) causes a proprietary trap notification to be sent to the NMS.

pgMonPortErrorHysteresis.name: pgMonPortErrorHysteresis
pgMonPortErrorHysteresis.description: pgMonPortErrorHysteresis is the hysteresis value for the error rate in percent which if crossed (after a Threshold cross) causes a proprietary trap notification to be sent to the NMS.

pgMonPortLinkStatus.name: pgMonPortLinkStatus
pgMonPortLinkStatus.description: pgMonPortLinkStatus indicates whether the port state is link pass or link fail. This status is applicable to the following cards: Ethernet Twisted Pair, Ethernet Optical Module. Ports on other cards will report Not-Applicable for this status.

pgMonPortJabberStatus.name: pgMonPortJabberStatus
pgMonPortJabberStatus.description: pgMonPortJabberStatus indicates whether the port is currently jabbering or not. This status is applicable to the following cards: Ethernet Twisted Pair, Ethernet Optical Module. Ports on other cards will report Not-Applicable for this status.

pgMonPortTransmitCollisions.name: pgMonPortTransmitCollisions
pgMonPortTransmitCollisions.description: pgMonPortTransmitCollisions is incremented each time a port transmits and receives data simultaneously or two ports receive data simultaneously.

pgConcModel.name: pgConcModel
pgConcModel.description: pgConcModel is the model number of the concentrator for order entry purposes.

pgConcSerialNumber.name: pgConcSerialNumber
pgConcSerialNumber.description: pgConcSerialNumber is the serial number of the concentrator.

pgConcTemperature.name: pgConcTemperature
pgConcTemperature.description: pgConcTemperature indicates operating temperature state for the concentrator.

pgConcPowerSupply.name: pgConcPowerSupply
pgConcPowerSupply.description: pgConcPowerSupply indicates dual-redundant power supply status for the concentrator.

pgWarmStartReset.name: pgWarmStartReset
pgWarmStartReset.description: pgWarmStartReset is an action requesting a warm start of the concentrator system. All counters are cleared for all Hubs and a Warm Start Trap is issued to the NMS.

pgColdStartReset.name: pgColdStartReset
pgColdStartReset.description: pgColdStartReset is an action requesting a cold start of the concentrator system. If the value is resetWithCurrentConfig then all counters are cleared for all Hubs with the concentrator configuration kept intact. If the value is resetWithDefaultConfig then all counters are cleared for all Hubs with the concentrator configuration reset to default values. All Repeaters are reset and a Cold Start Trap is issued to the NMS.

pgNetPackSelftest.name: pgNetPackSelftest
pgNetPackSelftest.description: pgNetPackSelftest is an action requesting the Selftest of any one of the system NetPacks.

pgReturnToPrimaryMS.name: pgReturnToPrimaryMS
pgReturnToPrimaryMS.description: pgReturnToPrimaryMS is an action requesting the return of the Agent to the specified primary channel for communication to its primary NMS.

pgHubColdReset.name: pgHubColdReset
pgHubColdReset.description: pgHubColdReset is an action requesting the clearing of all counters and statistics for the specified Hub.

pgHubWarmReset.name: pgHubWarmReset
pgHubWarmReset.description: pgHubWarmReset is an action requesting the Reset of counters for the specified Hub in the System, without any affect on the configuration. The MPR for the specified Hub will not be reset.

duphmBasicHubTable.name: duphmBasicHubTable
duphmBasicHubTable.description: duphmBasicHubTable is table depicting the basic 802.3 Hub Management objects.

duphmBasicHubEntry.name: duphmBasicHubEntry
duphmBasicHubEntry.description: duphmBasicHubEntry is the entry for a specifed Hub in the duphmBasicHubTable.

pgSetSuccess.name: pgSetSuccess
pgSetSuccess.description: The pgSetSuccess trap is generated by the agent upon the successful completion of a Set Request that set the value of the dupportadminState variable. This response is not to be confused with the Get Response message which is automatically generated by the agent in response to a Set Request. This trap is used to verify at the Management Station that Set Requests which require reliance on external hardware have completed successfully. It is also designed to notify other management stations monitoring the agent that a Set Request has successfully occurred and the concentrator configuration should be appropriately updated.

pgSetFailure.name: pgSetFailure
pgSetFailure.description: The pgSetFailure trap is generated by the agent upon the unsuccessful completion of an unsuccessful Set Request that attempted to set the value of the dupportadminState variable. This response is not to be confused with the Get Response message which is automatically generated by the agent in response to a Set Request. This trap is used to notify the Management Station of the failure of a Set Request which has already sent a Get Response reply to the Management Station.

pgThresholdCrossed.name: pgThresholdCrossed
pgThresholdCrossed.description: The pgThresholdCrossed trap is generated by the agent upon recognition of a threshold being crossed as defined by the user. The variables sent in the trap are first the rate of the variable whose threshold has crossed and second the threshold that has been crossed. These two variables must be present for this trap to process correctly. Allowable variable combinations are pgChannelIPGCount and pgChannelIPGThreshold, pgMonPortCollRate and pgMonPortCollThreshold, and pgMonPortErrorRate and pgMonPortErrorThreshold.

pgHysteresisCrossed.name: pgHysteresisCrossed
pgHysteresisCrossed.description: The pgHysteresisCrossed trap is generated by the agent upon recognition of a hysteresis value being crossed as defined by the user. The trap is sent to notify the management station that the variable has recovered from the condition that caused the pgThresholdCrossed trap to occur. This trap will always be preceded by a pgThresholdCrossed trap. The variables sent in the trap are first the rate of the variable whose hysteresis value has crossed and second the hysteresis value that has been crossed. These two variables must be present for this trap to process correctly. Allowable variable combinations are pgMonPortCollRate and pgMonPortCollHysteresis, and pgMonPortErrorRate and pgMonPortErrorHysteresis.

pgGroupMapChange.name: pgGroupMapChange
pgGroupMapChange.description: This trap is generated upon recognition of a change in the group map as described in IEEE 802.3 Hub Management Specification. The trap is sent when a change occurs in the concentrator's group map, resulting from the insertion or removal of a card from a concentrator.
pgGroupMapChange.reference: Reference IEEE 802.3 Hub Management Specification, groupMapChange notification.

pgSelfTestResults.name: pgSelfTestResults
pgSelfTestResults.description: The pgSelfTestResults trap is generated upon finding that a command request for a selftest has completed execution. This trap is issued on completion of a self test requested by a Set Request. The variables in this trap include the statuses of the object or objects that performed selftests and their current values. There must be at least one variable for this trap to process correctly, and there may be multiple variables. Allowable variables are pgAgentDaughterboard, pgAgentInternalBus, pgAgentCorrelator, pgAgentNetPackStatus1, pgAgentNetPackStatus2, pgAgentNetPackStatus3, pgAgentNetPackStatus4, pgAgentNetPackStatus5,and pgAgentNetPackStatus6.

pgDaughterboardTimeout.name: pgDaughterboardTimeout
pgDaughterboardTimeout.description: The pgDaughterboardTimeout trap is sent if the communication between the Agent Module and the Daughterboard has ceased. This trap may only be sent if the Daughterboard is installed on the Agent Module.

pgInternalBusTimeout.name: pgInternalBusTimeout
pgInternalBusTimeout.description: The pgInternalBusTimeout trap is sent if the communication between the Agent Module Foreground and the Internal Bus has timed out. This trap denotes a hardware failure.

pgInternalBusHardwareError.name: pgInternalBusHardwareError
pgInternalBusHardwareError.description: The pgInternalBusHardwareError trap is sent if the response received from the Internal Bus does not match the expected response. The receipt of this trap signifies an Internal Bus hardware failure.

pgOverTemperature.name: pgOverTemperature
pgOverTemperature.description: The pgOverTemperature trap is generated upon finding that an Over Temperature condition has been reported by the temperature sensing mechanism in the Agent Module.

pgPowerSupplyFailure.name: pgPowerSupplyFailure
pgPowerSupplyFailure.description: The pgPowerSupplyFailure trap is generated upon finding that a failure has been noted in one of the Dual-Redundant Power Supplies as reported by the Agent Module power supply sensing mechanism.

pgErrorCondition.name: pgErrorCondition
pgErrorCondition.description: The pgErrorCondition trap is generated upon finding that an error condition has occurred in the Agent Module. The variables in this trap include the object or objects that were involved in the error and their error statuses. There must be at least one variable for this trap to process correctly, and there may be multiple variables. Allowable variables are pgAgentDaughterboard, pgAgentInternalBus, pgAgentCorrelator, pgAgentSerialPrt, pgAgentNetPackStatus1, pgAgentNetPackStatus2, pgAgentNetPackStatus3, pgAgentNetPackStatus4, pgAgentNetPackStatus5,and pgAgentNetPackStatus6.

pgSecurityViolation.name: pgSecurityViolation
pgSecurityViolation.description: The pgSecurityViolation trap is generated upon finding that a security violation has occurred. This proprietary security mechanism is fully explained in the Agent Module User's Manual.
pgSecurityViolation.reference: Reference the Paragon Intelligent Networking System Owner's Manual SNMP Agent Module.

pgHubHealth.name: pgHubHealth
pgHubHealth.description: The pgHubHealth trap is generated upon finding that the health of the concentrator or some element in it has changed. The value of duphubHealthData and the corresponding text in duphubHealthText notify the management station of the specific change that has occurred. Depending on the change and the corresponding values of duphubHealthData and duphubHealthText the fourth variable will be either dupportAdminState or duphubAutoPartitionState. This fourth variable provides additional information to the management station about the change in the system that was noted.
pgHubHealth.reference: Reference 802.3 Hub Management Specification for more detail on HubHealth.

pgLinkStatus.name: pgLinkStatus
pgLinkStatus.description: The pgLinkStatus is generated by the agent upon finding that the link status of a port has changed. The variable pgMonPortLinkStatus will hold the current link status of the port identified by the instance.

pgMPRErrors.name: pgMPRErrors
pgMPRErrors.description: The pgMPRErrors trap is generated by the agent to notify the Management Station that the MPR is experiencing an error condition. The variable pgMonGroupMPRStatus indicates the error condition.
